concept-wr.title: Compute Node Management
concept-wr.shortdesc: The compute nodes in Titanium Server form a resource pool for hosting guest instances. You can manage this pool by managing the hosts.

conbody.p: You can change the resource pool in several ways:

li.p: You can add or remove hosts to increase or decrease the size of the pool.
You can replace a host with another that has different resources (for example, memory, or number of CPU cores).
You can adjust the resources on an existing host.
You can replace a failed compute node host with an equivalent.

note.p: When replacing or adjusting a host, ensure that the overall resource pool still meets the requirements for your system.
